do we build security hub we think about why in through these four major buckets
first we talk to customers and customers especially ones in regulated industries
have large backlogs of compliance rules that they want to build out for their

thousands of hours parsing and normalizing these data sets to get them into a common format so that they can be
easily searched to analyze that obviously takes a lot of time and effort but they're also seeing lots of alerts
our largest security hub customer today is pushing a million alerts per day into
security hub and certainly as you get to those larger volumes you need tooling to help you prioritize
which alerts are most important and most require action and investigation but
also what are the underlying resources associated those alerts that most urgently need your attention
and then lastly folks want an integrated view they want to integrate view across
all their accounts so if you're dealing with dozens or hundreds even thousands of accounts your security team wants a
consolidated view across all those accounts and they want a consolidated view across both their security and
compliance issues typically what we see is that the most common cause of a data breach in a customer environments is due
to insecure configurations of s3 buckets I am roles or users etc and so
compliance is a key security concern for AWS customers often times in more legacy
environments I see security and compliance teams being very separate in AWS those teams need to work
hand-in-hand oftentimes it's the same person dealing with security and compliance issues so that's what why we
build security hub in terms of what scuri up does it's designed to be a very easy on experience with one or two
clicks from the management console you can turn on security hub and once you turn on security hub for single accounts
you start automatically aggregating findings or alerts from your key AWS
security services like guard duty inspector and may seem and then we've integrated with 30 additional partner
products and all those integrations we've done both on the AWS side and on
the partner side they're all sending in their alerts to security hub in a standardized format we call that the AWS
security finding format so as a customer you don't need to do any parsing or
normalization we've taken care of all that pain upstream the finding provider
or the alert provider is taking care of that on their end we're giving you tools
to help you prioritize those alerts so we're converting all those alerts into a standardized severity scoring scale and
we have prepackaged searches we call those manage insights that allow you to quickly drill
into which resources have the most problems in terms of consolidation of
alerts on those resources by the way one click to turn that on for a single

across all accounts across all regions by running a simple script but that's

is the CE is the Center for Internet Security AWS foundations benchmark we
have a bunch of other compliance standards coming out beginning this year but for the CIS standard there are 43
controls that we've included in our standard and each of those controls we

covers in some cases we're doing some things beyond config rules but literally
